value: File:Port Townsend - Adams Street at night.jpg

From U.S. 101 at the tip of Discovery Bay, SR-20 splits off and runs 13 miles to downtown.  Traffic coming from the Seattle area will want to take one of the many ferries across Puget Sound to reach the peninsula.  Driving the land route alone, Port Townsend is roughly a two hour drive north of

value: . Port Townsend's and Jefferson County's public transit system. Serves Port Townsend from
content=There is a ferry connecting Port Townsend and

, on Whidbey Island.  The small ferries required by Coupeville's narrow harbor mean that vehicle space is often limited, and drive-up motorists may have to wait several sailings for a space.  Guaranteed reservations can be made in advance
or by calling 511, and are all but essential on Friday afternoons, weekends and holidays; another alternative is driving south via SR-19 and SR-104 (Hood Canal Bridge) to the larger ferries at
.  Pedestrians and bicyclists will never have a problem boarding the ferry.

Everything is in a easy walking distance. When you don't feel like walking it is easy to catch a bus to anywhere in the town.

value: content=Features beaches, many trails, and abandoned military bunkers.
content=On the National Historic Registry. Also one of the most haunted buildings in America.
A house in the historic district
See Port Townsend historic district, where there are still a lot of Victorian buildings in a "time capsule" atmosphere.
See a movie at the Rose Theatre, which gets mostly indie films that only open in certain theatres, or at the Uptown Theatre.
In mid to late September Port Townsend has it's film festival where there's movies indoors and outdoors during the night. This is one of the biggest independent film festivals in the world.
Stroll around on the downtown strip, visiting the interesting shops.
In the summer, relax on the beaches at Fort Worden. (You can camp there too either on the beach or furter inland.)
Port Townsend also holds a Wooden Boat Festival also in September.
content=Rent a bicycle and pedal around town or on local trails! Many styles and sizes to choose from at The Broken Spoke bicycle shop.

content=The best pizza in town! Buy it by the slice or order a full pizza with all your favorites and dine upstairs in the funky atmosphere.
